entry.title: When: Friday, Feb 26 from 4-9pm, MST & Saturday, Feb 27 from...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

When: Friday, Feb 26 from 4-9pm, MST & Saturday, Feb 27 from 9am-4pm, MST
Where: Virtual ‚Äì Registration required
This event is FREE and open to everyone in the community! Please join us online.
To register, visit: https://whova.com/web/cbhs_202102/
The 2021 Collaborative Black Health Summit will provide you with relevant and actionable information and connect you to community resources! CAA Health is creating a space of mutual support and connectedness to showcase strategies ...and best practices for helping our community members achieve their highest level of health and well-being.
The summit will feature a variety of speakers, presentations, and interactive breakout sessions. Here are some highlights of what to expect:
- Keynote by Dr. Terri Richardson and a panel discussion on COVID-19 health and vaccine information featuring, Dr. Oswaldo "Ozzie" Grenardo, Dr. Sheila Davis & Dr. Stephaun Wallace
- A presentation by Morehouse School of Medicine‚Äôs National COVID-19 Resiliency Network (NCRN)
- Entertainment by performing artists, including Tony Exum Jr., Dianne Reeves, and Mr. Charles Doss & The Let‚Äôs Start Dancing Crew
- Data on health/healthcare outcomes and disparities
- How to find and access community resources and assistance programs
- How to stay healthy and socially connected
- Learn skills and receive training and tips for self-care, parenting, health advocacy, and community engagement
Please consider subscribing to our e-newsletter to stay up-to-date on events and service offerings at www.caahealth.org.
Any questions? Please contact Eric Moore at Eric@caahealth.org or 303-355-3423 ext. 112.

See More

FRI, FEB 26 - FEB 27

Collaborative Black Health Summit

Online EventHealth ¬∑ 109 people

entry.title: If you're unclear on why image descriptions are necessary,...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

If you're unclear on why image descriptions are necessary, or why all caps in hashtags are a problem, please read! We owe it to our disabled community members to strive to be more access-centered in everything we do. And since everything we do is now posted to social media there are some easy steps we can take to to not leave folks out of the conversation. #BlackDisabledLivesMatter #AccessCentered #Accessibility

https://www.shondaland.com/‚Ä¶/make-your-social-media-more-a‚Ä¶/

AOC's consistent use of video captioning is definitely leading the way.

shondaland.com

Is Your Social Media Accessible to Everyone? These 9 Best Practices Can Help

AOC's consistent use of video captioning is definitely leading the way.AOC's consistent use of video captioning is definitely leading the way.

entry.title: Black Lives Matter 5280Denzel CaldwellGood Morning. Drink some water. Pour some libations for our Ancestors. Day 16 of #blackhistorymonth ...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280Denzel Caldwell

Good Morning. Drink some water. Pour some libations for our Ancestors.

Day 16 of #blackhistorymonth

"Left of Marx: The Political Life of Black Communist Cla...udia Jones" by Carole Bryce Davies

The work and contributions of Black Leftist revolutionaries are rich and spread throughout their Diaspora. It is especially important that we note the work of our Sisters who engaged in protracted revolutionary struggle, because there is currently an attempt to absorb Black Women into the status quo.

Comrade Claudia Jones work was so deeply principled and impactful that she was buried to the left of Karl Marx. Know her name. Study her life.

Have a great day.

See More

entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

This is the same chemical that was likely used in Denver all summer too, jsyk.

#DefundThePolice

"The United States‚Äôs routine use of potentially lethal chemical weapons in urban areas, often during peaceful or nonviolent protests, in ways that affect the entire populace as well as the environment. ‚ÄúI plead with all law enforcement agencies who have HC in their arsenal to decommission it immediately,‚Äù Simonis said. ‚ÄúThere is no reason for any police agency to possess it.‚Äù

...

entry.title: ‚ÄúAs winter drags on, people must reimagine the ways they‚Äôve...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

‚ÄúAs winter drags on, people must reimagine the ways they‚Äôve been surviving the pandemic, says Apryl Alexander, a clinical and forensic psychologist and an associate professor at the University of Denver‚Äôs Graduate School of Professional Psychology. ‚ÄúWith economic strain and cold weather comes the loss of many of the activities ‚Äî online shopping and outdoor activities ‚Äî that were giving us distractions and connections,‚Äù Alexander says.‚Äù

With more than 450,000 dead and no clear end in sight, some have found tools for coping with loss and stress are no longer working.

vox.com

What you‚Äôre feeling is grief

entry.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280‚Äôs Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...

coloradogives.org
